net.fec.openrq.decoder

Interface SourceBlockDecoder


  • public interface SourceBlockDecoder
    A decoder for a source block.

    A source block decoder is retrieved from a DataDecoder object, which is associated to some source data. Source data is divided into source blocks and each source block is independently encoded by a RaptorQ encoder (as specified in RFC 6330). Each source block is further divided into source symbols, which together with repair symbols (extra encoded data) form the encoding symbols. The encoding symbols are transmitted inside encoding packets to specific source blocks of the data being decoded.

    A source block can be decoded independently by an instance of SourceBlockDecoder, and the block is identified by a source block number, which is carried inside an encoding packet. The method sourceBlockNumber() provides the source block number that identifies the source block being decoded. Additionally, the number of source symbols into which the source block is divided is given by the method numberOfSourceSymbols().

    The method putEncodingPacket(EncodingPacket) receives an encoding packet as argument and stores the encoding symbols inside it for future decoding. If at the time the method is called, enough symbols are available for decoding the source block, then a decoding operation takes place which either succeeds or not (a decoding failure).

    Handling decoding failures is a task for the user. Typically, the user requests the sender for any missing source symbols or simply waits for more encoding symbols (source or repair) to be available. The method missingSourceSymbols() returns a set with the identifiers of all missing source symbols, and the method availableRepairSymbols() returns a set with the identifiers of all available repair symbols so far.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<Integer> availableRepairSymbols()
      Returns a set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the available repair symbols for decoding.
      boolean containsRepairSymbol(int esi)
      Returns true if, and only if, this decoder contains the repair symbol with the provided encoding symbol identifier.
      boolean containsSourceSymbol(int esi)
      Returns true if, and only if, this decoder contains the source symbol with the provided encoding symbol identifier.
      DataDecoder dataDecoder()
      Returns the data decoder object from which this source block decoder was retrieved.
      boolean isSourceBlockDecoded()
      Returns true if, and only if, the source block being decoded is fully decoded.
      Set<Integer> missingSourceSymbols()
      Returns a set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the missing source symbols from the source block being decoded.
      int numberOfSourceSymbols()
      Returns the total number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being decoded.
      SourceBlockState putEncodingPacket(EncodingPacket packet)
      Receives an encoded packet containing encoding symbols for the source block being decoded.
      int sourceBlockNumber()
      Returns the source block number for the source block being decoded.

    • Method Detail

      • dataDecoder

        DataDecoder dataDecoder()
        Returns the data decoder object from which this source block decoder was retrieved.
        Returns:
        the data decoder object from which this source block decoder was retrieved

      • sourceBlockNumber

        int sourceBlockNumber()
        Returns the source block number for the source block being decoded.
        Returns:
        the source block number for the source block being decoded

      • numberOfSourceSymbols

        int numberOfSourceSymbols()
        Returns the total number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being decoded.
        Returns:
        the total number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being decoded

      • containsSourceSymbol

        boolean containsSourceSymbol(int esi)
        Returns true if, and only if, this decoder contains the source symbol with the provided encoding symbol identifier.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being decoded, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi < K
        Parameters:
        esi - An encoding symbol identifier for a specific source symbol
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this decoder contains the specified source symbol
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid
        See Also:
        numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • containsRepairSymbol

        boolean containsRepairSymbol(int esi)
        Returns true if, and only if, this decoder contains the repair symbol with the provided encoding symbol identifier.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being decoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ K
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        Parameters:
        esi - An encoding symbol identifier for a specific repair symbol
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this decoder contains the specified repair symbol
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid
        See Also:
        numberOfSourceSymbols()

      • isSourceBlockDecoded

        boolean isSourceBlockDecoded()
        Returns true if, and only if, the source block being decoded is fully decoded. A source block is considered fully decoded when it contains all of its source symbols.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, the source block being decoded is fully decoded
        See Also:
        containsSourceSymbol(int)

      • missingSourceSymbols

        Set<Integer> missingSourceSymbols()
        Returns a set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the missing source symbols from the source block being decoded. The returned set has an iteration ordering of ascending encoding symbol identifiers.
        Returns:
        a set of encoding symbol identifiers of missing source symbols

      • availableRepairSymbols

        Set<Integer> availableRepairSymbols()
        Returns a set of integers containing the encoding symbol identifiers of the available repair symbols for decoding. If the source block is already decoded, then an immutable empty set is returned instead.

        The returned set iteration follows the order by which repair symbols have been received.

        Returns:
        a set of encoding symbol identifiers of available repair symbols, or an immutable empty set if the source block is already decoded

      • putEncodingPacket

        SourceBlockState putEncodingPacket(EncodingPacket packet)
        Receives an encoded packet containing encoding symbols for the source block being decoded. If enough symbols (source and repair) are available, then a decoding operation takes place.

        The result of this method invocation is a SourceBlockState value:

        INCOMPLETE:
        means that not enough encoding symbols are available for a decoding operation.
        DECODED:
        means that a decoding operation took place and succeeded in decoding the source block.
        DECODING_FAILURE:
        means that a decoding operation took place but failed in decoding the source block; additional encoding symbols are required for a successful decoding.
        Parameters:
        packet - An encoding packet containing encoding symbols associated to the source block being decoded
        Returns:
        a SourceBlockState value indicating the result of the method invocation (see method description)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If packet.sourceBlockNumber() != this.sourceBlockNumber()
